itemDescription: Welsh rugby union and rugby league footballer

wikipedia_page.main: George Hayward (13 February 1886 – 13 October 1946) was a Welsh international rugby union forward who played club rugby for Swansea, and was capped for Wales on five occasions and was part of the 1908 Home Nations Championship winning team.

response: * George Hayward (MP), Member of Parliament (MP) for Bridgnorth
* George Hayward (rugby) (1887–1948), Welsh international rugby union forward

Harry Toft played alongside fellow Swansea RFC players; George Hayward, Phil Hopkins, Fred Lewis, Ivor Morgan and Dicky Owen (captain) in Glamorgan County RFC's 3–16 defeat by Australia at Cardiff Arms Park on Wednesday 7 October 1908.
